definition: to enchant and delight someone

quotes.quote: You have bewitched me body and soul, and I love, I love, I love you. And wish from this day forth never to be parted from you.
quotes.author: JANE AUSTEN

quotes.quote: But now, I think I'm learning. You bewitched me from the first time that you kissed me. Waited all night; then we ran down the street in the late London light. The world froze around us, you kissed me good night
quotes.author: LAUFEY

quotes.quote: I'm wild again, beguiled again. A simpering, whimpering child again. Bewitched, bothered, and bewildered am I
quotes.author: ELLA FITZGERALD

howTo.title: USE THE ENCHANTING GAZE
howTo.description: Lock eyes with your target in a crowded room, focusing with intent and confidence. Let your gaze convey a sense of mystery and intrigue, drawing them in without saying a word.

howTo.title: HAVE AN ENIGMATIC AURA
howTo.description: Maintain an air of intrigue by sharing just enough about yourself to pique interest. Keep certain aspects of your life mysterious, encouraging others to wonder about the secrets you hold.

howTo.title: LEAVE A WHIRLWIND OF MYSTERY
howTo.description: Leave behind subtle clues or symbols that hint at hidden knowledge or a deeper story. Use intriguing props or create mysterious encounters that linger in people's minds.

howTo.title: WHISPER DELICATE WORDS
howTo.description: Speak softly and deliberately, choosing words that evoke curiosity or suggest hidden meanings.

howTo.title: PRACTICE YOUR SPELLBINDING LAUGHTER
howTo.description: Laugh with a hint of mystery, as if sharing a private joke with the universe. Let your laughter be infectious, leaving others intrigued and wanting to join in.

howTo.title: HAVE AN UNMATCHED CHARISMA
howTo.description: Cultivate an aura of charismatic mystery. Share glimpses of your true self while keeping certain aspects shrouded in secrecy.

purpose.title: IT SPICES UP THEIR LIFE
purpose.description: Inject a dose of enchantment to break the monotony and add a sprinkle of magic to their everyday life.

purpose.title: GIVE THEM ALLURING STORIES
purpose.description: Gift them with tales of bewitching encounters, adding a touch of mystery and intrigue to their personal narrative.

purpose.title: CHANGE THEIR MUNDANE INTO MARVEL
purpose.description: Transform ordinary situations into extraordinary experiences, making their life a little bit more fantastical and whimsical.

purpose.title: ENHANCE THEIR SENSE OF WONDER
purpose.description: Cast spells of curiosity and awe, and maybe they will become inspired by your approaches to embrace spontaneity.

definition: to shine with a bright, shimmering reflected light

quotes.quote: My sister had taught me to look at the world that way, as a place that glitters, as a place where the calls of the crickets and the crows and the wind are everyday occurrences that also happen to be magic.
quotes.author: CYNTHIA KADOHATA

quotes.quote: For now she need not think of anybody. She could be herself, by herself. And that was what now she often felt the need of - to think; well not even to think. To be silent; to be alone. All the being and the doing, expansive, glittering, vocal, evaporated; and one shrunk, with a sense of solemnity, to being oneself, a wedge-shaped core of darkness, something invisible to others... and this self having shed its attachments was free for the strangest adventures.
quotes.author: VIRGINIA WOOLF

quotes.quote: And above all, watch with glittering eyes the whole world around you because the greatest secrets are always hidden in the most unlikely places. Those who don't believe in magic will never find it.
quotes.author: ROALD DAHL

quotes.quote: All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost;The old that is strong does not wither,Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
quotes.author: J.R.R. TOLKIEN

howTo.title: GLOW WITH CONFIDENCE
howTo.description: Embrace self-assurance and authenticity, radiating confidence and empowerment that inspires and encourages others to shine as well.

howTo.title: SHARE YOUR INNER RADIANCE
howTo.description: Cultivate a vibrant and positive inner light that shines through your demeanor and interactions, uplifting those around you with warmth and positivity.

howTo.title: ENCOURAGE SPARKLING CONVERSATIONS
howTo.description: Engage in conversations that sparkle with curiosity and depth, sharing insights and stories that captivate and leave a lasting impression.

howTo.title: DISPLAY EMPATHY
howTo.description: Show compassion and understanding, embodying empathy that lights up connections and fosters meaningful relationships.

howTo.title: HAVE RESILIENCE
howTo.description: Face challenges with grace and resilience, demonstrating strength and perseverance that glitters like a beacon of hope in adversity.

howTo.title: LIVE WITH NEW PERSPECTIVE
howTo.description: See the beauty and magic in everyday moments, appreciating the wonder of existence and sharing that perspective with a twinkle in your eye.

howTo.title: FIND A RADIANT PURPOSE
howTo.description: Live with intention and purpose, pursuing goals and dreams that illuminate your path and inspire others to pursue their own aspirations.

purpose.title: ILLUMINATE THE ORDINARY FOR YOURSELF
purpose.description: Infuse everyday interactions with a hint of magic, turning simple encounters into glittering memories.

purpose.title: BRIGHTEN DULL MOMENTS
purpose.description: Transform ordinary occasions into dazzling celebrations, adding a touch of sparkle to even the most mundane gatherings.

purpose.title: SPREAD JOY TO OTHERS
purpose.description: Emit a radiant aura of positivity and happiness, leaving a trail of smiles wherever you go.

definition: task done for pleasure, not reward

quotes.quote: We accept the love we think we deserve.
quotes.author: STEPHEN CHBOSKY

quotes.quote: Perhaps one did not want to be loved so much as to be understood.
quotes.author: GEORGE ORWELL

quotes.quote: Never love anyone who treats you like you're ordinary.
quotes.author: OSCAR WILDE

quotes.quote: So, I love you because the entire universe conspired to help me find you.
quotes.author: PAULO COHELO

quotes.quote: The only thing worse than a boy who hates you: a boy that loves you.
quotes.author: MARKUS ZUSACK

quotes.quote: Above all, don't lie to yourself. The man who lies to himself and listens to his own lie comes to a point that he cannot distinguish the truth within him, or around him, and so loses all respect for himself and for others. And having no respect he ceases to love.
quotes.author: FYODOR DOSTOVESKY

quotes.quote: Every heart sings a song, incomplete, until another heart whispers back. Those who wish to sing always find a song. At the touch of a lover, everyone becomes a poet.
quotes.author: PLATO

quotes.quote: The more I know of the world, the more I am convinced that I shall never see a man whom I can really love. I require so much!
quotes.author: JANE AUSTEN

quotes.quote: Hearts are made to be broken.
quotes.author: OSCAR WILDE

quotes.quote: I will love you as a thief loves a gallery and as a crow loves a murder, as a cloud loves bats and as a range loves braes. I will love you as misfortune loves orphans, as fire loves innocence and as justice loves to sit and watch while everything goes wrong.
quotes.author: LEMONY SNICKETT

howTo.title: SET CLEAR INTENTIONS
howTo.description: Begin by clarifying your purpose and motivation behind the task. Understand why it's important to you and how it aligns with your values and aspirations.

howTo.title: PATIENCE AND PERSERVERENCE
howTo.description: Approach the task with a mindset of patience and persistence. Understand that achieving excellence takes time and effort, and be willing to stay committed through challenges.

howTo.title: PASSION IN DETAILS
howTo.description: Pour your heart and soul into the work, paying attention to even the smallest details. Let your passion drive the quality and creativity of your efforts.

howTo.title: SEEKING INSPIRATION
howTo.description: Draw inspiration from sources that resonate with you, whether it's art, nature, or personal experiences. Welcome constructive feedback to refine and improve your work.

howTo.title: YOUR MILESTONES
howTo.description: Acknowledge and celebrate each milestone achieved along the way. Reflect on how far you've come and use this momentum to propel you forward.

howTo.title: BEING PRESENT AND MINDFUL
howTo.description: Practice mindfulness while working, staying fully engaged in the process and appreciating each moment as it unfolds.

howTo.title: SELF-CARE
howTo.description: Maintain a healthy balance between dedication to your task and self-care. Honor your physical, mental, and emotional well-being throughout the journey.

howTo.title: YOUR TRUE VISION
howTo.description: Stay aligned with your original vision while remaining open to creative possibilities. Trust your instincts and intuition as you navigate challenges and decisions.

howTo.title: RELFECTION AND RENEWAL
howTo.description: Take time to reflect on the experience and lessons learned. Use this reflection to renew your commitment and continue growing in your pursuit of creating something meaningful.

purposeTitle: WHY YOU SHOULD LABOR FOR LOVE

purpose.title: TYRANNY OF BOREDOM
purpose.description: Break free from the clutches of monotony by immersing yourself in projects that excite and inspire.

purpose.title: YOUR INNER CONNOISSEUR
purpose.description: Hone your skills and expertise in a chosen field, turning your hobby into a pursuit of mastery.

purpose.title: SYMPHONY OF SUCCESS
purpose.description: Compose your life's opus by dedicating yourself to pursuits that resonate deeply with your heart and soul.

purpose.title: FULFILLMENT
purpose.description: Construct a fortress of fulfillment through activities that bring you joy and satisfaction.

purpose.title: THE ZEN OF ZEAL
purpose.description: Embody the zen-like state of flow that comes from engaging in tasks that you genuinely love and enjoy.

definition: to stop feeling angry or resentful toward someone for an offense, flaw, or mistake

quotes.quote: You won't understand what I mean now, but someday you will: the only trick of friendship, I think, is to find people who are better than you are—not smarter, not cooler, but kinder, and more generous, and more forgiving—and then to appreciate them for what they can teach you, and to try to listen to them when they tell you something about yourself, no matter how bad—or good—it might be, and to trust them, which is the hardest thing of all. But the best, as well.
quotes.author: HANYA YANIGHARA

quotes.quote: Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much.
quotes.author: OSCAR WILDE

quotes.quote: Death must be so beautiful. To lie in the soft brown earth, with the grasses waving above one's head, and listen to silence. To have no yesterday, and no tomorrow. To forget time, to forgive life, to be at peace.
quotes.author: OSCAR WILDE

quotes.quote: I could easily forgive his pride, if he had not mortified mine.
quotes.author: JANE AUSTEN

quotes.quote: Children begin by loving their parents; as they grow older they judge them; sometimes they forgive them.
quotes.author: OSCAR WILDE

howTo.title: ACKNOWLEDGE YOUR FEELINGS
howTo.description: Begin by acknowledging and accepting your emotions, whether it's anger, hurt, or resentment. Allow yourself to feel these emotions without judgment.

howTo.title: UNDERSTAND YOUR EMOTIONS
howTo.description: Take time to understand the circumstances that led to the hurt or offense. Try to see the situation from different perspectives, including the other person's point of view.

howTo.title: CHOOSE TO FORGIVE
howTo.description: Make a conscious decision to forgive. Understand that forgiveness is for your own healing and does not necessarily excuse the behavior of the person who hurt you.

howTo.title: RELEASE YOUR RESENTMENT
howTo.description: Let go of negative emotions by practicing empathy and compassion. Recognize that holding onto resentment only prolongs your own suffering.

howTo.title: SET BOUNDARIES
howTo.description: Establish healthy boundaries to protect yourself from further harm. Forgiveness does not mean allowing yourself to be mistreated repeatedly.

howTo.title: SELF-HEALING
howTo.description: Engage in self-care activities that promote healing and well-being. This may include meditation, journaling, therapy, or spending time in nature.

howTo.title: RELEASE EXPECTATIONS
howTo.description: Let go of expectations of how the other person should respond to your forgiveness. Focus on your own growth and healing.

howTo.title: GIVE YOURSELF TIME
howTo.description: Forgiveness is a process that may take time. Be patient with yourself and allow yourself to heal at your own pace.

purpose.title: LESS EMOTIONAL BAGGAGE
purpose.description: Release the weight of grudges and grievances caused to you by others. This will free you from unnecessary emotional burdens.

purpose.title: INNER PEACE
purpose.description: Create a tranquil state of mind by letting go of resentments and embracing forgiveness.

purpose.title: MAINTAIN GOOD KARMA
purpose.description: Maintain good karma by practicing forgiveness, ensuring positive vibes and cosmic harmony.

purpose.title: PREVENT WRINKLES FORMING
purpose.description: Prevent premature aging by smiling more often, fueled by the liberating power of forgiveness. Retinol is expensive

definition: showing gentleness and concern or sympathy

quotes.quote: I wasn't actually in love, but I felt a sort of tender curiosity.
quotes.author: F. SCOTT FITZGERALD

quotes.quote: Sometimes being offered tenderness feels like the very proof that you've been ruined.
quotes.author: OCEAN VUONG

quotes.quote: There's a Korean word my grandma taught me. It's called jung. It's the connection between two people that can’t be severed, even when love turns to hate. You still have those old feelings for them; you can’t ever completely shake them loose of you; you will always have tenderness in your heart for them.
quotes.author: JENNY HAN

quotes.quote: Men are born soft and supple; dead they are stiff and hard. Plants are born tender and pliant; dead, they are brittle and dry. Thus whoever is stiff and inflexible is a disciple of death. Whoever is soft and yielding is a disciple of life. The hard and stiff will be broken. The soft and supple will prevail.
quotes.author: LAO TZU

quotes.quote: People talk of “social outcasts.” The words apparently denote the miserable losers of the world, the vicious ones, but I feel as though I have been a “social outcast” from the moment I was born. If ever I meet someone society has designated as an outcast, I invariably feel affection for him, an emotion which carries me away in melting tenderness.
quotes.author: OSAMU DAZAI

quotes.quote: I wish I could do whatever I liked behind the curtain of “madness”. Then: I’d arrange flowers, all day long, I’d paint; pain, love and tenderness, I would laugh as much as I feel like at the stupidity of others, and they would all say: “Poor thing, she’s crazy!” (Above all I would laugh at my own stupidity.) I would build my world which while I lived, would be in agreement with all the worlds. The day, or the hour, or the minute that I lived would be mine and everyone else’s - my madness would not be an escape from “reality”.
quotes.author: FRIDA KAHLO

quotes.quote: And he cries and cries, cries for everything he has been, for everything he might have been, for every old hurt, for every old happiness, cries for the shame and joy of finally getting to be a child, with all of a child's whims and wants and insecurities, for the privilege of behaving badly and being forgiven, for the luxury of tenderness, of fondness, of being served a meal and being made to eat it, for the ability, at last, at last, of believing a parent's reassurances, of believing that to someone he is special despite all his mistakes and hatefulness, because of all his mistakes and hatefulness.
quotes.author: HANYA YANIGHARA

howTo.title: PRACTICE SELF-COMPASSION
howTo.description: Start by showing kindness and understanding towards yourself. Practice self-care and self-compassion by acknowledging your needs and treating yourself with gentleness.

howTo.title: EXPRESS AFFECTION
howTo.description: Show affection and appreciation to loved ones through words, gestures, or acts of kindness. Expressing love and warmth fosters a sense of tenderness in relationships.

howTo.title: NURTURE AND NATURE
howTo.description: Spend time in nature to nurture a sense of tenderness towards the natural world. Connect with the beauty and tranquility of the environment.

howTo.title: SHOW GRATITUDE
howTo.description: Foster a sense of gratitude for the small joys and blessings in life. Appreciate moments of tenderness and connection, fostering a heart that is open and receptive.

howTo.title: SPEAK DECIDEDLY
howTo.description: Use gentle and compassionate language when communicating. Choose words that uplift and encourage, avoiding harshness or criticism.

purpose.title: EMOTIONAL INTELLIGENCE
purpose.description: Level up your sensitivity stat to navigate life's challenges with finesse and empathy.

purpose.title: A NINJA OF COMPASSION
purpose.description: Master the art of tender -heartedness, stealthily and sometimes violently spreading kindness and understanding wherever you go.

purpose.title: POWER OF GENTLE PERSUASION
purpose.description: Influence others with the irresistible charm of your new found approach with words.

purpose.title: BETTER HUGGER
purpose.description: Elevate the quality of your hugs by infusing them with genuine tenderness and warmth.

purpose.title: LESS TEA TO SPILL
purpose.description: Navigate through life's dramatic twists and keep personal dramas at bay

definition: relating to or affecting the senses rather than the intellect

quotes.quote: Be near me when my light is low, When the blood creeps, and the nerves prick and tingle; and the heart is sick,And all the wheels of Being slow. Be near me when the sensuous frame is rack'd with pangs that conquer trust; And Time, a maniac scattering dust, And Life, a fury slinging flame.
quotes.author: ALFRED LORD TENNYSON

quotes.quote: The voice of the sea is seductive; never ceasing, whispering, clamoring, murmuring, inviting the soul to wander for a spell in abysses of solitude; to lose itself in mazes of inward contemplation.The voice of the sea speaks to the soul. The touch of the sea is sensuous, enfolding the body in its soft, close embrace.
quotes.author: KATE CHOPIN

quotes.quote: I love New York on summer afternoons when everyone's away. There's something very sensuous about it - overripe, as if all sorts of funny fruits were going to fall into your hands.
quotes.author: F. SCOTT FITZGERALD

howTo.title: EXPLORE SENSORY EXPERIENCES
howTo.description: Indulge in sensory-rich activities that heighten your awareness. Try cooking a delicious meal, savoring a fine wine, or immersing yourself in nature.

howTo.title: SENSUAL TOUCH
howTo.description: Connect with your body through gentle touch. Practice self-massage, take a warm bath, or enjoy intimate moments of physical closeness with a partner.

howTo.title: AESTHETICS
howTo.description: Surround yourself with beauty. Admire art, listen to music that moves you, and create a space that stimulates your senses visually and emotionally.

howTo.title: EXPLORE NEW MOVEMENT
howTo.description: Move your body in ways that feel pleasurable and expressive. Try dancing, yoga, or other forms of movement that allow you to connect with your physical self.

howTo.title: TEXTURE AND COMFORT
howTo.description: Surround yourself with soft fabrics and textures that feel comforting and luxurious. Treat yourself to cozy blankets, silky fabrics, or plush pillows.

howTo.title: RELATIONSHIPS
howTo.description: Foster intimacy and connection with your partner through affectionate touch, deep conversations, and shared experiences that ignite passion and closeness.

howTo.title: SENSUALITY IN NATURE
howTo.description: Spend time outdoors and connect with the natural world. Feel the warmth of the sun on your skin, listen to the rustling of leaves, and breathe in the fresh air.

howTo.title: ENHANCING SCENT
howTo.description: Explore aromatherapy or use scented candles, essential oils, or perfumes that evoke positive emotions and create a sensuous atmosphere.

howTo.title: EMBRACE MINDFULNESS
howTo.description: Practice being fully present in the moment. Engage your senses by noticing the sights, sounds, smells, tastes, and textures around you.

purposeTitle: WHY YOU SHOULD BE MORE SENSUOUS

purpose.title: NEW AWAKENING
purpose.description: Tap into a world of heightened sensations, turning everyday experiences into sensory adventures.

purpose.title: ENHANCE APPRECIATION
purpose.description: Elevate your enjoyment of the finer things in life by savoring each moment with sensuous delight.

purpose.title: PLEASURE
purpose.description: Develop a refined palate for pleasure, indulging in sensory experiences that titillate the senses.

purpose.title: NEW EXPERIENCES
purpose.description: Transform mundane activities into sensual escapades, infusing them with a touch of magic and allure.

definition: to make amends or reparation

quotes.quote: God is dead. God remains dead. And we have killed him. How shall we comfort ourselves, the murderers of all murderers? What was holiest and mightiest of all that the world has yet owned has bled to death under our knives: who will wipe this blood off us? What water is there for us to clean ourselves? What festivals of atonement, what sacred games shall we have to invent? Is not the greatness of this deed too great for us? Must we ourselves not become gods simply to appear worthy of it?
quotes.author: FRIEDRICH NEITZSCHE

quotes.quote: Nothing erases the past. There is repentance, there is atonement, and there is forgiveness. That is all, but that is enough.
quotes.author: TED CHIANG
quotes.source: THE MERCHANT AND THE ALCHEMIST'S GATE

quotes.quote: A single gentle rain makes the grass many shades greener. So our prospects brighten on the influx of better thoughts. We should be blessed if we lived in the present always, and took advantage of every accident that befell us, like the grass which confesses the influence of the slightest dew that falls on it; and did not spend our time in atoning for the neglect of past opportunities, which we call doing our duty. We loiter in winter while it is already spring.
quotes.author: HENRY DAVID THOREAU

howTo.title: ACKNOWLEDGE RESPONSIBILITY
howTo.description: Take ownership of your actions and their consequences. Recognize the impact of your behavior on others and accept accountability without making excuses.

howTo.title: EXPRESS REMORSE
howTo.description: Take ownership of your actions and their consequences. Recognize the impact of your behavior on others and accept accountability without making excuses.

howTo.title: APOLOGIZE WITH EMPATHY
howTo.description: Offer a heartfelt apology that acknowledges the specific ways in which your actions affected others. Express empathy and understanding towards the feelings of those you hurt.

howTo.title: LISTEN AND VALIDATE
howTo.description: Listen actively to the perspectives and emotions of those affected by your actions. Validate their feelings and demonstrate a willingness to understand their experience.

howTo.title: MAKING AMENDS
howTo.description: Take tangible steps to repair the damage and make things right. Offer to rectify the situation, provide restitution if necessary, and actively work towards resolving any lingering issues.

howTo.title: CHANGE BEHAVIOR
howTo.description: Demonstrate genuine commitment to change by addressing underlying issues or patterns of behavior. Take proactive steps to prevent similar mistakes in the future.

howTo.title: SEEK FORGIVENESS
howTo.description: Humbly request forgiveness from those you've hurt, but understand that forgiveness is a process that may take time. Respect the other person's feelings and decisions.

howTo.title: REFLECT AND LEARN
howTo.description: Engage in self-reflection to understand the motivations behind your actions and identify areas for personal growth. Learn from your mistakes and use them as opportunities for self-improvement.

howTo.title: FORGIVE YOURSELF.
howTo.description: Finally, forgive yourself for your past actions while committing to personal growth and positive change. Practice self-compassion and allow yourself the opportunity to heal and move forward.

purpose.title: MAINTAIN RELATIONSHIPS
purpose.description: Maintain harmonious relationships by owning up to errors and making amends when needed.

purpose.title: RESPECT AND TRUST
purpose.description: Build credibility and earn the respect of others by demonstrating accountability and maturity.

purpose.title: EMOTIONAL BAGGAGE
purpose.description: Lighten your mental load by releasing guilt and fostering a sense of closure through atonement.

definition: the spiritual or immaterial part of a human being or animal, regarded as immortal

quotes.quote: He's more myself than I am. Whatever our souls are made of, his and mine are the same.
quotes.author: EMILY BRONTE

quotes.quote: god must have kneaded you and i from the same dough, rolled us out as one on the baking sheet; must have suddenly realized how unfair it was to put that much magic in one person and sadly split that dough in two; how else is it that when i look in the mirror, i am looking at you; when you breathe, my own lungs fill with air; that we just met but we have known each other our whole lives; if we were not made as one to begin with
quotes.author: RUPI KAUR

quotes.quote: Who does ever get what they want? It doesn’t seem to happen to many of us if any at all. It’s always two people bumping against each other blindly, acting out old ideas and dreams and mistaken understandings.
quotes.author: KENT HARUF

howTo.title: SELF-RELFECTION
howTo.description: Set aside time for introspection and self-reflection. Reflect on your thoughts, emotions, and experiences to gain deeper insights into yourself.

howTo.title: YOUR PASSIONS AND INTERESTS
howTo.description: Identify activities that ignite your passion and bring you joy. Engage in hobbies, creative pursuits, or meaningful projects that resonate with your soul.

howTo.title: SPIRITUAL PRACTICES
howTo.description: Explore spiritual practices that resonate with you, such as meditation, prayer, yoga, or mindfulness. These practices can deepen your spiritual connection and inner peace.

howTo.title: ENGAGING LITERATURE
howTo.description: Explore books, poetry, or spiritual texts that inspire and uplift your soul. Seek wisdom and insight from literature that resonates with your spiritual journey.

howTo.title: ALIGN TO YOUR VALUES
howTo.description: Identify your core values and strive to live in alignment with them. Make choices and decisions that reflect your authentic self and bring you closer to your true purpose.

howTo.title: LEARNING TO LET GO
howTo.description: Release resentment and forgive yourself and others for past hurts. Embrace forgiveness as a pathway to inner freedom and peace.

purposeTitle: WHY YOU SHOULD NURTURE YOUR SOUL

purpose.title: YOUR INNER GARDEN
purpose.description: Transform your soul into a flourishing oasis of wisdom, compassion, and inner beauty.

purpose.title: CELEBRATE YOUR BEAUTY
purpose.description: Nurturing your soul encourages appreciation for the beauty of existence, fostering gratitude and awe for life's wonders.

purpose.title: HARMONY AND BALANCE
purpose.description: Nurturing your soul involves cultivating inner harmony and balance, fostering a sense of peace and well-being amidst life's challenges.

definition: belonging to the essential nature or constitution of a thing

quotes.quote: To have that sense of one's intrinsic worth which constitutes self-respect is potentially to have everything: the ability to discriminate, to love and to remain indifferent. To lack it is to be locked within oneself, paradoxically incapable of either love or indifference...
quotes.author: JOAN DIDION

quotes.quote: And that sadness is intrinsically part of the fabric of happiness. You can’t have one without the other. Of course, they come in different degrees and quantities. But there is no life where you can be in a state of sheer happiness for ever. And imagining there is just breeds more unhappiness in the life you’re in.
quotes.author: MATT HAIG

quotes.quote: Men intrinsically do not trust new things that they have not experienced themselves.
quotes.author: NICCOLO MACHIAVELLI

howToTitle: HOW TO REFLECT INTRINSIC HUMAN NATURE

howTo.title: ARTISTIC CREATION
howTo.description: Engaging in art forms such as painting, drawing, sculpting, or music composition allows for creative expression and emotional release.

howTo.title: CONNECTING WITH NATURE
howTo.description: Spending time in natural environments, such as hiking, gardening, or simply enjoying a sunset, fosters a sense of connection with the world around us.

howTo.title: EXPLORING CURIOSITY
howTo.description: Pursuing knowledge, whether through reading, exploring new subjects, or engaging in intellectual discussions, satisfies our innate curiosity and thirst for understanding.

howTo.title: RITUALS AND TRADITIONS
howTo.description: Participating in cultural rituals, celebrations, and traditions honors our shared heritage and sense of belonging within communities.

howTo.title: PHYSICAL MOVEMENT AND PLAY
howTo.description: Activities like dancing, playing sports, or engaging in physical exercise reflect our instinctive need for movement, vitality, and joy.

howTo.title: NURTURING RELATIONSHIPS
howTo.description: Building and maintaining meaningful relationships with family, friends, and loved ones fulfills our inherent need for companionship, support, and intimacy.

purposeTitle: WHY YOU SHOULD EMBRACE HUMAN NATURE

purpose.title: THE ESSENCE OF BEING
purpose.description: Dive into the depths of human experience, embracing the quirks, passions, and vulnerabilities that make us uniquely human.

purpose.title: SHARED STORIES
purpose.description: Engage in the timeless tradition of storytelling, weaving narratives that resonate with universal themes of joy, struggle, and resilience.

purpose.title: FOR MEANING
purpose.description: Embark on a quest for meaning and purpose, uncovering truths that resonate with the depths of our intrinsic nature.

purpose.title: EMOTIONS
purpose.description: Explore the rich tapestry of emotions that define our existence, from laughter and love to sorrow and longing.

definition: to a very distant or unreachable place

quotes.quote: So, now I shall talk every night. To myself. To the moon. I shall walk, as I did tonight, jealous of my loneliness, in the blue-silver of the cold moon, shining brilliantly on the drifts of fresh-fallen snow, with the myriad sparkles. I talk to myself and look at the dark trees, blessedly neutral. So much easier than facing people, than having to look happy, invulnerable, clever. With masks down, I walk, talking to the moon, to the neutral impersonal force that does not hear, but merely accepts my being. And does not smite me down.
quotes.author: SYLVIA PLATH

quotes.quote: Don't tell me the moon is shining; show me the glint of light on broken glass.
quotes.author: ANTON CHEKHOV

quotes.quote: Yes: I am a dreamer. For a dreamer is one who can only find his way by moonlight, and his punishment is that he sees the dawn before the rest of the world.
quotes.author: OSCAR WILDE

howToTitle: HOW TO TAKE YOURSELF TO THE MOON

howTo.title: EMOTIONAL DISTANCE
howTo.description: Establish emotional boundaries or detach yourself from intense feelings or situations that feel overwhelming or unattainable.

howTo.title: INTROSPECTIVE REFLECTION
howTo.description: Spend time in introspection, contemplating aspects of yourself or your life that feel distant or unexplored.

howTo.title: UNREACHABLE DREAMS
howTo.description: Reflect on aspirations or dreams that seem out of reach. Embrace the journey of pursuing these dreams, regardless of the outcome.

howTo.title: SYMBOLIC EXPRESSION
howTo.description: Use symbolic art forms, such as poetry, painting, or music, to express feelings of longing or the sense of being in an unreachable place.

howTo.title: BEAUTY IN TRANSCENDENCE
howTo.description: Embrace the beauty of transcending limitations or boundaries, whether physical, emotional, or spiritual.

howTo.title: SOLITUDE AND SILENCE
howTo.description: Retreat into moments of solitude and silence to disconnect from external pressures and distractions.

howTo.title: YOUR PERCIEVED LIMITATIONS
howTo.description: Question self-imposed limitations or societal expectations that may contribute to feelings of being stuck or unreachable.

purposeTitle: WHY YOU SHOULD TAKE YOURSELF TO THE MOON

purpose.title: EXPANDING YOUR HORIZONS
purpose.description: Embark on metaphorical journeys of exploration and discovery, pushing the boundaries of your comfort zone to experience new perspectives and possibilities.

purpose.title: REACH FOR THE UNREACHABLE
purpose.description: Set audacious goals and aspirations that challenge conventional limits, inspiring yourself and others to strive for the extraordinary.

purpose.title: NEW PERSPECTIVES
purpose.description: Gain a higher vantage point on life's challenges and opportunities, viewing them from a metaphorical 'moon' where obstacles appear smaller and solutions seem clearer.

definition: an amount that has to be paid or spent to buy or obtain something

quotes.quote: Anything that costs money is cheap
quotes.author: JOHN STEINBECK

quotes.quote: It was only a sunny smile, and little it cost in the giving, but like morning light it scattered the night and made the day worth living.
quotes.author: F. SCOTT FITZGERALD

quotes.quote: Animals have these advantages over man: they never hear the clock strike, they die without any idea of death, they have no theologians to instruct them, their last moments are not disturbed by unwelcome and unpleasant ceremonies, their funerals cost them nothing, and no one starts lawsuits over their wills.
quotes.author: VOLTAIRE

quotes.quote: Contemplation seems to be about the only luxury that costs nothing.
quotes.author: DODIE SMITH

howToTitle: HOW TO DETERMINE THE COST OF YOURSELF

howTo.title: ASSESS YOUR SKILLS
howTo.description: Evaluate your strengths, talents, and skills. Identify what you excel at and how your unique abilities contribute to your personal and professional life.

howTo.title: CONSIDER YOUR ACCOMPLISHMENTS
howTo.description: Reflect on your past achievements and accomplishments. Recognize the challenges you've overcome and the milestones you've achieved in various areas of your life.

howTo.title: YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS AND IMPACT
howTo.description: Assess the ways in which you contribute to your community, workplace, or relationships. Consider the positive impact you have on others and the value you bring to different environments.

howTo.title: YOUR EMOTIONAL WELL-BEING
howTo.description: Take stock of your emotional well-being and self-care practices. Consider how you nurture your mental and emotional health and the importance you place on self-care.

howTo.title: ASSESS YOUR FINANCIAL WORTH
howTo.description: Evaluate your financial situation and resources. Consider your earning potential, financial goals, and how you manage your finances to support your lifestyle and future plans.

purposeTitle: WHY YOU SHOULD DETERMINE YOUR COST

purpose.title: GAIN CLARITY
purpose.description: Reflect on your skills, qualities, and contributions to understand your worth in various contexts, allowing you to negotiate confidently and advocate for fair treatment.

purpose.title: SETTING EXPECTATIONS
purpose.description: Knowing your 'cost' empowers you to establish boundaries and communicate expectations in personal and professional interactions, promoting respect and fairness.

purpose.title: SELF-WORTH AS CURRENCY
purpose.description: Viewing yourself in terms of 'cost' highlights the importance of self-esteem and self-respect, encouraging you to invest in personal growth and well-being.

purpose.title: CHALLENGE STEREOTYPES
purpose.description: Understanding your value challenges societal norms and biases that undermine individual worth, advocating for equality and recognition of diverse talents.

definition: not able to occur, exist, or be done

quotes.quote: The creatures outside looked from pig to man, and from man to pig, and from pig to man again; but already it was impossible to say which was which.
quotes.author: GEORGE ORWELL

quotes.quote: When you have eliminated all which is impossible, then whatever remains, however improbable, must be the truth.
quotes.author: SIR ARTHUR CONAN DOYLE
quotes.source: THE CASE BOOK OF SHERLOCK HOLMES

quotes.quote: Music expresses that which cannot be said and on which it is impossible to be silent.
quotes.author: VICTOR HUGO

quotes.quote: Maybe I was destined to forever fall in love with people I couldn’t have. Maybe there’s a whole assortment of impossible people waiting for me to find them. Waiting to make me feel the same impossibility over and over again.
quotes.author: CAROL RUKFA BRUN

howTo.title: CLARIFY YOUR VISION
howTo.description: Define your goal clearly and vividly. Visualize what accomplishing this goal looks like and why it's important to you.

howTo.title: SETTING OBJECTIVES
howTo.description: Break down the impossible goal into smaller, actionable objectives. Define specific milestones that will lead you closer to your ultimate goal.

howTo.title: GATHERING RESEARCH
howTo.description: Educate yourself about the challenges and requirements of your goal. Gather information, resources, and insights from experts or mentors.

howTo.title: CONSISTENT ACTION
howTo.description: Commit to taking consistent and disciplined action towards your goal. Break the inertia by starting small and building momentum over time.

howTo.title: GROWING FROM FAILURE
howTo.description: View failures as learning opportunities. Analyze setbacks objectively, identify lessons learned, and adjust your approach accordingly.

howTo.title: POWER OF BELIEF
howTo.description: Cultivate a strong belief in yourself and your ability to achieve the impossible. Visualize success and maintain a positive attitude throughout the journey.

howTo.title: SERENDIPITY
howTo.description: Remain open to unexpected opportunities or fortunate events that can propel you forward towards your goal.

purposeTitle: WHY YOU SHOULD CONQUER THE IMPOSSIBLE

purpose.title: REVEL IN THE ABSURDITY
purpose.description: Embracing impossible challenges with a humorous twist exposes the absurdity of human endeavor and the fleeting nature of ambition.

purpose.title: DEFY THE INEVITABLE
purpose.description: Challenging the impossible can be an act of rebellion against fate and inevitability, asserting autonomy in the face of daunting odds.

purpose.title: EMBRACING DEFEAT
purpose.description: Confronting impossible tasks humorously acknowledges the inevitability of failure, allowing for the release of tension and expectation.

purpose.title: HUBRIS
purpose.description: Confronting the impossible with humor exposes the hubris and folly of human ambition, inviting introspection and humility.

definition: sad because one has no friends or company; without companions

quotes.quote: You once told me that the human eye is god's loneliest creation. How so much of the world passes through the pupil and still it holds nothing. The eye, alone in its socket, doesn't even know there's another one, just like it, an inch away, just as hungry, as empty.
quotes.author: OCEAN VUONG

quotes.quote: Why do people have to be this lonely? What's the point of it all? Millions of people in this world, all of them yearning, looking to others to satisfy them, yet isolating themselves. Why? Was the earth put here just to nourish human loneliness?
quotes.author: HARUKI MURAKAMI

quotes.quote: All great and precious things are lonely.
quotes.author: JOHN STEINBECK

quotes.quote: The trouble is not that I am single and likely to stay single, but that I am lonely and likely to stay lonely.
quotes.author: CHARLOTTE BRONTE

howTo.title: THE ECHOES OF SILENCE
howTo.description: Sink into the quietude of loneliness, where the absence of voices amplifies the emptiness within.

howTo.title: IN THE VOID
howTo.description: Drift through the vast expanse of isolation, feeling adrift in a world devoid of connection or purpose.

howTo.title: INANIMATE OBJECTS
howTo.description: Turn to inanimate objects for solace, treating them as silent confidants in moments of loneliness.

howTo.title: UNANSWERED CALLS
howTo.description: Wait for the phone to ring, only to be met with silence, echoing the void of interpersonal connection.

howTo.title: FEELING THE IRONY
howTo.description: Scroll through endless feeds of curated lives, feeling more isolated amidst the illusion of digital connectivity.

purpose.title: PERSONAL REFLECTION
purpose.description: Loneliness offers moments of introspection and self-discovery, allowing you to explore your thoughts and emotions in depth.

purpose.title: QUIET IN SOLITUDE
purpose.description: Embracing loneliness can provide a break from the noise and demands of social interactions, offering a sense of peace and tranquility.

purpose.title: EXISTENTIAL QUESTIONS
purpose.description: Solitude invites contemplation of life's uncertainties and existential questions, prompting deeper introspection and philosophical inquiry.

purpose.title: INNER STRENGTHS
purpose.description: Embracing loneliness can cultivate resilience and self-reliance, encouraging personal growth and the development of coping strategies.

definition: to form a mental image or concept of

quotes.quote: There must be something in books, things we can't imagine, to make a woman stay in a burning house; there must be something there. You don't stay for nothing.
quotes.author: RAY BRADBURY

quotes.quote: I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library.
quotes.author: JORGE LUIS BORGES

quotes.quote: A lady's imagination is very rapid; it jumps from admiration to love, from love to matrimony in a moment.
quotes.author: JANE AUSTEN

quotes.quote: Sometimes fate is like a small sandstorm that keeps changing directions. You change direction but the sandstorm chases you. You turn again, but the storm adjusts. Over and over you play this out, like some ominous dance with death just before dawn. Why? Because this storm isn't something that blew in from far away, something that has nothing to do with you. This storm is you. Something inside of you. So all you can do is give in to it, step right inside the storm, closing your eyes and plugging up your ears so the sand doesn't get in, and walk through it, step by step. There's no sun there, no moon, no direction, no sense of time. Just fine white sand swirling up into the sky like pulverized bones. That's the kind of sandstorm you need to imagine.
quotes.author: HARUKI MURAKAMI

quotes.quote: If we, citizens, do not support our artists, then we sacrifice our imagination on the altar of crude reality and we end up believing in nothing and having worthless dreams.
quotes.author: YANN MARTEL

quotes.quote: I do know that for the sympathy of one living being, I would make peace with all. I have love in me the likes of which you can scarcely imagine and rage the likes of which you would not believe. If I cannot satisfy the one, I will indulge the other.
quotes.author: MARY SHELLY

howTo.title: RELAXING ENVIRONMENT
howTo.description: Find a quiet and comfortable space where you can relax and focus without distractions. Creating a conducive environment can help stimulate your imagination.

howTo.title: FREEFORM THINKING
howTo.description: Allow your thoughts to wander freely without judgment. Embrace daydreaming and let your imagination roam wherever it leads.

howTo.title: MENTAL IMAGERY
howTo.description: Practice visualizing scenes, objects, or concepts in your mind's eye. Use mental imagery to vividly picture details and textures.

howTo.title: WHAT IF?
howTo.description: Challenge yourself with thought-provoking questions that begin with 'What if?' Explore alternative scenarios and possibilities to stimulate creative thinking.

howTo.title: DIVERSITY IN CONTENT
howTo.description: Immerse yourself in books, films, art, and music that spark your imagination. Expose yourself to diverse ideas and narratives to broaden your creative horizon.

howTo.title: BRAINSTORMING
howTo.description: Collaborate with friends, colleagues, or fellow creatives to exchange ideas and inspire each other's imagination. Organize brainstorming sessions to generate collective creativity.

howTo.title: CHALLENGING ASSUMPTIONS
howTo.description: Question assumptions and challenge conventional thinking patterns. Embrace unconventional ideas and explore alternative perspectives.

howTo.title: PRACTICING PLAYFULNESS
howTo.description: Approach imagination with a spirit of playfulness and experimentation. Allow yourself to make mistakes and learn from the process of exploring new ideas.

purpose.title: EXPANDING HORIZONS
purpose.description: Imagination opens doors to new possibilities and creative ventures, allowing you to explore innovative ideas and solutions.

purpose.title: ESCAPE MONOTONY
purpose.description: Embracing imagination offers an escape from the mundane, infusing life with excitement and spontaneity.

purpose.title: CONVENTIONAL THINKING
purpose.description: Imagination encourages questioning of norms and conventions, promoting fresh perspectives and unconventional approaches.

purpose.title: SHADOWS OF UNCERTAINTY
purpose.description: Imagination can also lead to introspection and contemplation, confronting uncertainties and exploring the complexities of life.

definition: the state of being awake and aware of one's surroundings

quotes.quote: Until they become conscious they will never rebel, and until after they have rebelled they cannot become conscious.
quotes.author: GEORGE ORWELL

quotes.quote: There was time before organisms experienced consciousness, and there will be time after. And if the inevitability of human oblivion worries you, I encourage you to ignore it. God knows that’s what everyone else does.
quotes.author: JOHN GREEN

quotes.quote: God, but life is loneliness, despite all the opiates, despite the shrill tinsel gaiety of 'parties' with no purpose, despite the false grinning faces we all wear. And when at last you find someone to whom you feel you can pour out your soul, you stop in shock at the words you utter - they are so rusty, so ugly, so meaningless and feeble from being kept in the small cramped dark inside you so long. Yes, there is joy, fulfillment and companionship - but the loneliness of the soul in its appalling self-consciousness is horrible and overpowering.
quotes.author: SYLVIA PLATH

quotes.quote: She is all the great heroines of the world in one. She is more than an individual. I love her, and I must make her love me. I want to make Romeo jealous. I want the dead lovers of the world to hear our laughter, and grow sad. I want a breath of our passion to stir dust into consciousness, to wake their ashes into pain.
quotes.author: OSCAR WILDE

quotes.quote: Once upon a time, I dreamt I was a butterfly, fluttering hither and thither, to all intents and purposes a butterfly. I was conscious only of my happiness as a butterfly, unaware that I was myself. Soon I awaked, and there I was, veritably myself again. Now I do not know whether I was then a man dreaming I was a butterfly, or whether I am now a butterfly, dreaming I am a man.
quotes.author: ZHUANGZI

howTo.title: YOUR THOUGHTS AND FEELINGS
howTo.description: Keep a journal to record your thoughts, emotions, and experiences. Reflect on patterns and insights that emerge from your journal entries.

howTo.title: SEEKING OTHERS
howTo.description: Ask trusted friends, family members, or colleagues for feedback about your strengths, weaknesses, and blind spots. Be open to constructive criticism.

howTo.title: VULNERABILITY
howTo.description: Allow yourself to be vulnerable and authentic. Embrace imperfections and acknowledge areas where you can grow and evolve.

howTo.title: STAYING CURIOUS
howTo.description: Maintain a curious and open-minded attitude toward life. Stay receptive to new experiences, perspectives, and opportunities for growth.

howTo.title: EXPLORING YOUR PURPOSE
howTo.description: Reflect on your life purpose and aspirations. Set meaningful goals that align with your values and vision for the future.

howTo.title: YOUR VALUES AND BELIEFS
howTo.description: Take time to reflect on your core values, beliefs, and principles. Consider how these influence your decisions, behaviors, and interactions with others.

purpose.title: NAVIGATE THE MAZE
purpose.description: Gaining consciousness involves unraveling the intricate layers of your own mind, discovering hidden passions, fears, and desires along the way.

purpose.title: THE ART OF MINDFULNESS
purpose.description: Embracing consciousness allows you to practice mindfulness, tuning into the present moment and cultivating a deeper connection with your thoughts and emotions.

purpose.title: PERSONAL GROWTH
purpose.description: Consciousness is a journey of continuous growth and development, marked by milestones of self-awareness and introspection that shape your understanding of the world.

purpose.title: CHANGING THE STATUS QUO
purpose.description: Gaining consciousness empowers you to challenge societal norms and expectations, questioning assumptions and forging your own path based on personal insights.

purpose.title: EXISTENTIAL CURIOSITIES
purpose.description: Consciousness invites contemplation of existential questions, such as the nature of reality and the meaning of life, leading to humorous yet profound reflections on the human experience.

definition: in Hinduism and Buddhism, the sum of a person's actions in this and previous states of existence, viewed as deciding their fate in future existences

quotes.quote: Even chance meetings are the result of karma… Things in life are fated by our previous lives. That even in the smallest events there’s no such thing as coincidence.
quotes.author: HARUKI MURAKAMI

quotes.quote: Leave the problems of God to God and karma to karma. Today you’re here and nothing you can do will change that. Today you’re alive and here and honored, and blessed with good fortune. Look at this sunset, it’s beautiful, neh? This sunset exists. Tomorrow does not exist. There is only now. Please look. It is so beautiful and it will never happen ever again, never, not this sunset, never in all infinity.
quotes.author: JAMES CLAVELL

howTo.title: PRACTICE COMPASSION
howTo.description: Treat others with kindness and empathy. Show compassion toward those in need and offer support to individuals facing challenges.

howTo.title: INTEGRITY AND HONESTY
howTo.description: Uphold ethical values and principles in your actions. Practice honesty, fairness, and integrity in your interactions with others.

howTo.title: YOUR IMPACT
howTo.description: Regularly reflect on the impact of your actions on others and the world around you. Strive to leave a positive and meaningful legacy through your deeds.

howTo.title: POSITIVITY AND OPTIMISM
howTo.description: Share positive messages and uplifting energy with others. Radiate positivity through your words, actions, and attitude.

howTo.title: BE MINDFUL OF INTENTIONS
howTo.description: Reflect on your intentions behind your actions. Strive to act with positive intentions and avoid causing harm to others.

howTo.title: INSPIRE OTHERS
howTo.description: Offer encouragement and inspiration to those around you. Motivate others to pursue their goals and aspirations with confidence and determination.

purpose.title: GOODWILL
purpose.description: Giving karma involves spreading positivity and goodwill by offering kindness, support, and encouragement to others.

purpose.title: A RIPPLE EFFECT
purpose.description: Embracing the concept of karma can inspire a ripple effect of good deeds, fostering a sense of community and interconnectedness.

purpose.title: CHALLENGE THE NEGATIVES
purpose.description: Karma challenges negative energy and promotes a shift towards positive attitudes and actions, contributing to a more harmonious and uplifting environment.

definition: a strong personality or character in regards to a person; full of energy

quotes.quote: There is nothing I would not do for those who are really my friends. I have no notion of loving people by halves, it is not my nature.
quotes.author: JANE AUSTEN

quotes.quote: Life is a series of natural and spontaneous changes. Don't resist them; that only creates sorrow. Let reality be reality. Let things flow naturally forward in whatever way they like.
quotes.author: LAO TZU

quotes.quote: In the spring, at the end of the day, you should smell like dirt.
quotes.author: MARGARET ATWOOD

quotes.quote: Adopt the pace of nature: her secret is patience.
quotes.author: RALPH WALDO EMERSON

quotes.quote: The aim of life is self-development. To realize one's nature perfectly - that is what each of us is here for.
quotes.author: OSCAR WILDE

howToTitle: HOW TO BE A FORCE OF NATURE

howTo.title: CONTINUOUS GROWTH
howTo.description: Commit to lifelong learning and personal growth. Stay curious, explore new ideas, and expand your skills and knowledge.

howTo.title: AUTHENTICITY AND INTEGRITY
howTo.description: Lead by example with authenticity, integrity, and ethical principles. Build trust and credibility through your words and actions.

howTo.title: BE ADAPTABLE AND FLEXIBLE
howTo.description: Lead by example with authenticity, integrity, and ethical principles. Build trust and credibility through your words and actions.

howTo.title: ADVOCATE FOR CHANGE
howTo.description: Use your voice to advocate for causes and issues you care about. Stand up for justice, equality, and sustainability.

howTo.title: EMBODY COURAGE
howTo.description: Step outside your comfort zone and embrace risks with courage and boldness. Challenge yourself to push boundaries and make a difference.

howTo.title: COLLABORATION
howTo.description: Cultivate strong and supportive relationships with others. Collaborate with like-minded individuals and inspire teamwork and camaraderie.

purposeTitle: WHY YOU SHOULD BECOME A FORCE OF NATURE

purpose.title: HARNESSING ENERGY
purpose.description: Striving to become a force of nature involves cultivating unstoppable energy and resilience, embodying the power and vitality of natural phenomena.

purpose.title: TRANSFORMATION
purpose.description: Becoming a force of nature can inspire change and transformation in yourself and others, catalyzing growth and progress in personal and collective endeavors.

purpose.title: EMBRACING THE UNPREDICTABLE
purpose.description: Embodying the spirit of a force of nature invites a sense of adventure and spontaneity, embracing the wild and unpredictable aspects of life.

purpose.title: CHALLENGING CONVENTIONS
purpose.description: Becoming a force of nature challenges conventions and breaks barriers, pushing boundaries and paving the way for innovation and creativity.

definition: too great, intense, or awful to describe

quotes.quote: Be with me always - take any form - drive me mad! only do not leave me in this abyss, where I cannot find you! Oh, God! it is unutterable! I can not live without my life!
quotes.author: EMILY BRONTE

quotes.quote: Great souls die and our reality, bound to them, takes leave of us. Our souls, dependent upon their nurture,now shrink, wizened. Our minds, formed and informed by their radiance, fall away.We are not so much maddenedas reduced to the unutterable ignorance of dark, cold caves.
quotes.author: MAYA ANGELOU

quotes.quote: I am filled with unutterable loathing when I contemplate the religious pomp and show, together with the horrible inconsistencies, which every where surround me. We have men-stealers for ministers, women-whippers for missionaries, and cradle-plunderers for church members.
quotes.author: FREDERICK DOUGLASS

quotes.quote: Life is such unutterable hell, solely because it is sometimes beautiful. If we could only be miserable all the time, if there could be no such things as love or beauty or faith or hope, if I could be absolutely certain that my love would never be returned: how much more simple life would be. Unfortunately the happiness is there. There is always the chance that another heart will come to mine. I can't help hoping, and keeping faith, and loving beauty. Quite frequently I am not so miserable as it would be wise to be.
quotes.author: T.H. WHITE

quotes.quote: It always strikes me, and it is very peculiar, that, whenever we see the image of indescribable and unutterable desolation—of loneliness, poverty, and misery, the end and extreme of things—the thought of God comes into one's mind.
quotes.author: VINCENT VAN GOGH

howTo.title: CONFRONTING THE UNTHINKABLE
howTo.description: Allow yourself to confront experiences or truths that are deeply unsettling or overwhelming. Acknowledge the existence of profound challenges or existential fears.

howTo.title: WITNESS HUMAN TRAGEDY
howTo.description: Learn about or bear witness to instances of human suffering or atrocities that defy comprehension. Reflect on the unfathomable aspects of collective pain and trauma.

howTo.title: UNPREDICTABLE CHAOS
howTo.description: Navigate situations of chaos, uncertainty, or upheaval that challenge your sense of control or stability. Confront the profound unpredictability of life.

howTo.title: SIT WITH UNCOMFORTABLE EMOTIONS
howTo.description: Embrace moments of intense emotion, such as grief, fear, or despair, without seeking immediate resolution or explanation. Allow yourself to feel the weight of these emotions.

purpose.title: EMBODIMENT OF EXISTENTIAL DREAD
purpose.description: Embrace a persona that embodies the depths of despair and existential angst, rendering words inadequate in the face of your despair.

purpose.title: INSPIRE CRISIS IN OTHERS
purpose.description: Challenge people's perceptions and beliefs with your overwhelming sense of doom and gloom, leaving them questioning the meaning of life.

purpose.title: BLACK HOLE
purpose.description: Suck the happiness out of any room or situation, creating an atmosphere of profound negativity and despair.

definition: a moving mechanical device made in imitation of a human being

quotes.quote: Do you think I am an automaton? — a machine without feelings? and can bear to have my morsel of bread snatched from my lips, and my drop of living water dashed from my cup? Do you think, because I am poor, obscure, plain, and little, I am soulless and heartless? You think wrong! — I have as much soul as you
quotes.author: CHARLOTTE BRONTE

quotes.quote: When we blindly adopt a religion, a political system, a literary dogma, we become automatons.
quotes.author: ANAIS NIN

quotes.quote: You know what's so dreadful about dying is that you're completely on your own'; and it struck me, as my automaton knees went up and down, that I simply did not know a thing about my darling's mind and that quite possibly, behind the awful juvenile cliches, there was in her a garden and a twilight, and a palace gate - dim and adorable regions which happened to be lucidly and absolutely forbidden to me, in my polluted rags and miserable convulsions...
quotes.author: VLADIMIR NABOKOV

howTo.title: SUPPRESSING EMOTIONS
howTo.description: Train yourself to suppress any hint of emotion or spontaneity. Become a master of the poker face, showing no joy, sadness, or excitement in any situation.

howTo.title: THE ART OF MONOTONY
howTo.description: Embrace a monotonous lifestyle devoid of variety or excitement. Stick to rigid routines and avoid anything that deviates from the norm.

howTo.title: BLENDING IN
howTo.description: Aim to be forgettable and unremarkable. Blend into the crowd and avoid standing out in any way.

howTo.title: YES-MAN
howTo.description: Always say yes to everything and everyone. Agree with others' opinions and avoid expressing any dissenting views.

howTo.title: COMPLACENCY
howTo.description: Settle for mediocrity and avoid striving for personal growth or improvement. Embrace a mindset of complacency and low expectations.

howTo.title: OBEYING COMMANDS
howTo.description: Adopt a strict policy of unquestioning obedience. Always follow instructions, no matter how absurd or illogical they may seem.

howTo.title: AVOID CREATIVITY
howTo.description: Reject creativity and innovation. Stick to conventional thinking and avoid coming up with original ideas or solutions.

purposeTitle: WHY YOU SHOULD BECOME AN AUTOMATON

purpose.title: PEAK EFFICIENCY
purpose.description: Transform into a productivity machine, executing tasks with robotic precision and efficiency.

purpose.title: ESCAPING TYRANNY OF EMOTIONS
purpose.description: Free yourself from the complexities of human emotions, achieving a state of zen-like detachment.

purpose.title: BECOME EMPLOYEE OF THE MONTH
purpose.description: Impress bosses and colleagues with your unwavering focus and unwavering dedication to work.

definition: not deserving or worthy of something positive, especially help or praise

quotes.quote: By this curious turn of disposition I have gained the reputation of deliberate heartlessness; how undeserved, I alone can appreciate.
quotes.author: EMILY BRONTE

quotes.quote: People with self-respect have the courage of their mistakes. They know the price of things. If they choose to commit adultery, they do not then go running, in an access of bad conscience, to receive absolution from the wronged parties; nor do they complain unduly of the unfairness, the undeserved embarrassment, of being named co-respondent. They exhibit a certain toughness, a kind of moral nerve.
quotes.author: JOAN DIDION

quotes.quote: Some books are undeservedly forgotten; none are undeservedly remembered.
quotes.author: W.H. AUDEN

howToTitle: HOW TO BECOME UNDESERVING OF EVERYTHING

howTo.title: EXCESS HUMILITY
howTo.description: Exaggerate feelings of unworthiness and inadequacy. Embrace extreme humility to the point of self-deprecation in all aspects of life.

howTo.title: REJECT RECOGNITION
howTo.description: Refuse to accept compliments or praise from others. Downplay your achievements and dismiss any form of recognition.

howTo.title: MAGNIFY YOUR FAILURES
howTo.description: Hyperfocus on your perceived flaws and mistakes. Amplify feelings of guilt and self-doubt over even minor shortcomings.

howTo.title: INTERNALIZE UNREASONABLE EXPECTATIONS
howTo.description: Adopt unrealistic standards of perfection imposed by society or others. Feel perpetually inadequate and undeserving of happiness or success.Absorb and internalize external criticism or negativity. Allow others' opinions to reinforce your sense of being undeserving.

purpose.title: FINE ART OF REJECTION
purpose.description: Hone your skills in gracefully declining acts of kindness and assistance, leaving others baffled yet amused.

purpose.title: DEPTHS OF HUMULITY
purpose.description: Dive into the depths of humility by comically downplaying your worthiness of others' kindness and favor.

purpose.title: MASTERING AWKWARD ENCOUNTERS
purpose.description: Embrace social discomfort by becoming the awkward recipient of undeserved generosity and kindness.

definition: extreme pain, distress, anxiety

quotes.quote: Life, although it may only be an accumulation of anguish, is dear to me, and I will defend it.
quotes.author: MARY SHELLY

quotes.quote: All art is a kind of confession, more or less oblique. All artists, if they are to survive, are forced, at last, to tell the whole story; to vomit the anguish up.
quotes.author: JAMES BALDWIN

quotes.quote: Before him he saw two roads, both equally straight; but he did see two; and that terrified him--he who had never in his life known anything but one straight line. And, bitter anguish, these two roads were contradictory.
quotes.author: VICTOR HUGO

quotes.quote: The beauty of the world...has two edges, one of laughter, one of anguish, cutting the heart asunder.
quotes.author: VIRGINIA WOOLF

howTo.title: DWELL ON PAST SORROWS

howTo.title: COPING MECHANISMS

definition: of an amount or supply of something, unable to be used up because existing in abundance

quotes.quote: I was within and without, simultaneously enchanted and repelled by the inexhaustible variety of life.
quotes.author: F. SCOTT FITZGERALD

quotes.quote: Meanwhile, you hear the whirl and roar of the crowd in the vortex of life around you; you hear, you see, men living in reality; you see that life for them is not forbidden, that their life does not float away like a dream, like a vision; that their life is being eternally renewed, eternally youthful, and not one hour of it is the same as another; while fancy is so spiritless, monotonous to vulgarity and easily scared, the slave of shadows, of the idea, the slave of the first cloud that shrouds the sun... One feels that this inexhaustible fancy is weary at last and worn out with continual exercise, because one is growing into manhood, outgrowing one's old ideals: they are being shattered into fragments, into dust; if there is no other life one must build one up from the fragments.
quotes.author: FYODOR DOSTOVESKY

quotes.quote: “Her voice is full of money,” he said suddenly.That was it. I’d never understood before. It was full of money–that was the inexhaustible charm that rose and fell in it, the jingle of it, the cymbals’ song of it.
quotes.author: F. SCOTT FITZGERALD

quotes.quote: I believe that man will not merely endure: he will prevail. He is immortal, not because he alone among creatures has an inexhaustible voice, but because he has a soul, a spirit capable of compassion and sacrifice and endurance.
quotes.author: WILLIAM FAULKNER

quotes.quote: All is balanced in necessity; frightening vision for the mind. There are marvelous relations between beings and things, in this inexhaustible whole, from sun to grub, there is no scorn, each needs the other. Light does not carry terrestrial perfumes into the azure depths without knowing what it does with them; night distributes the stellar essence to the sleeping plants.
quotes.author: VICTOR HUGO

definition: darkness, the physical condtion of absence of light

quotes.quote: It's so much darker when a light goes out than it would have been if it had never shone.
quotes.author: JOHN STEINBECK

quotes.quote: Farewells can be shattering, but returns are surely worse. Solid flesh can never live up to the bright shadow cast by its absence. Time and distance blur the edges; then suddenly the beloved has arrived, and it's noon with its merciless light, and every spot and pore and wrinkle and bristle stands clear.
quotes.author: MARGARET ATWOOD

quotes.quote: Richard began to understand darkness: darkness as something solid and real, so much more than a simple absence of light. He felt it touch his skin, questing, moving, exploring: gliding through his mind. It slipped into his lungs, behind his eyes, into his mouth...
quotes.author: NEIL GAIMAN

definition: emitting light as a result of being heated

quotes.quote: You may only call me 'Mrs. Darcy'... when you are completely, and perfectly, and incandescently happy.
quotes.author: JANE AUSTEN

quotes.quote: Although, I admit, I desire, Occasionally, some backtalk From the mute sky, I can't honestly complain: A certain minor light may still lean incandescent; Out of kitchen table or chair, as if a celestial burning took Possession of the most obtuse objects now and then --
quotes.author: SYLVIA PLATH

quotes.quote: Eating fire is your ambition: to swallow the flame down, take it into your mouth, and shoot it forth, a shout or an incandescent tongue, a word exploding from you in gold, crimson, unrolling in a brilliant scroll; To be lit up from within vein by vein; To be the sun
quotes.author: MARGARET ATWOOD

quotes.quote: But if sleep it was, of what nature, we can scarcely refrain from asking, are such sleeps as these? Are they remedial measures—trances in which the most galling memories, events that seem likely to cripple life for ever, are brushed with a dark wing which rubs their harshness off and gilds them, even the ugliest, and basest, with a lustre, an incandescence? Has the finger of death to be laid on the tumult of life from time to time lest it rend us asunder? Are we so made that we have to take death in small doses daily or we could not go on with the business of living?
quotes.author: VIRGINIA WOOLF

quotes.author: SYLVIA PLATH

quotes.quote: Lost opportunities, lost possibilities, feelings we can never get back. That's part of what it means to be alive. But inside our heads - at least that's where I imagine it - there's a little room where we store those memories. A room like the stacks in this library. And to understand the workings of our own heart we have to keep on making new reference cards. We have to dust things off every once in awhile, let in fresh air, change the water in the flower vases. In other words, you'll live forever in your own private library.
quotes.author: HARUKI MURAKAMI

quotes.quote: Grown-ups never understand anything by themselves, and it is tiresome for children to be always and forever explaining things to them
quotes.author: ATOINE DE SAINT EXUPERY

quotes.quote: They say nothing lasts forever but they're just scared it will last longer than they can love it.

quotes.quote: But it is possible, it is possible: the old grief, by a great mystery of human life, gradually passes into quiet, tender joy; instead of young, ebullient blood comes a mild, serene old age: I bless the sun's rising each day and my heart sings to it as before, but now I love its setting even more, its long slanting rays, and with them quiet, mild, tender memories, dear images from the whole of a long and blessed life--and over all is God's truth, moving, reconciling, all-forgiving!

quotes.author: HANYA YANIGHARA

quotes.quote: What is the meaning of life? That was all- a simple question; one that tended to close in on one with years, the great revelation had never come. The great revelation perhaps never did come. Instead, there were little daily miracles, illuminations, matches struck unexpectedly in the dark; here was one.
quotes.author: VIRGINIA WOOLF

quotes.quote: The happy life is thought to be one of excellence; now an excellent life requires exertion, and does not consist in amusement. If Eudaimonia, or happiness, is activity in accordance with excellence, it is reasonable that it should be in accordance with the highest excellence; and this will be that of the best thing in us.
quotes.author: ARISTOTLE

quotes.quote: She is my morning, she is my evening; we have a love that blooms over and again, more beautifully each time than the last. You will see that we are not lovers like others, for whom love is both a punishment and a gift… Our love has never punished, only rewarded. Such love therein lies the eudaimonic life.
quotes.author: ROMAN PAYNE

definition: the state or situation of being alone

quotes.quote: I care for myself. The more solitary, the more friendless, the more unsustained I am, the more I will respect myself.
quotes.author: CHARLOTTE BRONTE

quotes.quote: I find it wholesome to be alone the greater part of the time. To be in company, even with the best, is soon wearisome and dissipating. I love to be alone. I never found the companion that was so companionable as solitude.
quotes.author: HENRY DAVID THOREAU

quotes.quote: And it came to me then. That we were wonderful traveling companions but in the end no more than lonely lumps of metal in their own separate orbits. From far off they look like beautiful shooting stars, but in reality they're nothing more than prisons, where each of us is locked up alone, going nowhere. When the orbits of these two satellites of ours happened to cross paths, we could be together. Maybe even open our hearts to each other. But that was only for the briefest moment. In the next instant we'd be in absolute solitude. Until we burned up and became nothing.
quotes.author: HARUKI MURAKAMI

howTo.title: CREATE RELAXING ATMOSPHERE

howTo.title: SET CONSISTENCY

definition: extremely happy, peaceful, or pictureesque, especially of a time or place

quotes.quote: The bourgeoisie, wherever it has got the upper hand, has put an end to all feudal, patriarchal, idyllic relations. It has pitilessly torn asunder the motley feudal ties that bound man to his 'natural superiors,' and has left remaining no other nexus between man and man than naked self-interest, callous 'cash payment.' It has drowned the most heavenly ecstasies of religious fervor, of chivalrous enthusiasm, of philistine sentimentalism, in the icy water of egotistical calculation.
quotes.author: KARL MARX

quotes.quote: You did right to hold fast to each other,' I said: as if the monster splinters were living things, and could hear me. 'I think, scathed as you look, and charred and scorched, there must be a little sense of life in you yet, rising out of that adhesion at the faithful, honest roots: you will never have green leaves more -- never more see birds making nests and singing idylls in your boughs; the time of pleasure and love is over with you; but you are not desolate: each of you has a comrade to sympathize with him in his decay.
quotes.author: CHARLOTTE BRONTE
